description: Probably an alteration of tuft, referring to the gold tassel on the cap worn by titled undergraduates at English universities.

entries.meaning: (Britain, derogatory) A person of the upper class or with pretensions to it, who usually communicates an air of superiority.
examples: I came home first class—up the front end with the toffs—semi-anaesthetised throughout the trip by caviar and free champagne—and to hell with frugality and the conservation of resources.
